item.title: PyCon UK 2022
item.description: This past weekend I’ve been attending PyCon UK. I’m particularly lucky in that I live a 10 min train ride from where it is located in Cardiff meaning its incredibly convenient and economic for me. As a Python dev located here, there’s literally no excuse not to attend. What makes it even more special this time round is that this is the first event since the pandemic started - the last being held in 2019.

item.title: Getting Poetry to use the active Pyenv to Create a Virtual Environment
item.description: I found with a new poetry install that it refused to use the pyenv version of Python. I needed to explicitly tell Poetry where to find the active pyenv: poetry env use -- $(which python) After this, it works as expected.
